definition.name: NXfit_function
definition.doc:
This describes a fit function that is used to fit data to any functional form.
A fit function is used to describe a set of data :math:`y_k, k = 1 ... M`, which are collected as a function of one or more independent variables :math:`x` at the points :math:`x_k`. The fit function :math:`f` describes these data in an approximate way as :math:`y_k \approx f(a_0, . . . a_n, x_k)`, where :math:`a_i, i = 0 . . . n` are the *fit parameters* (which are stored the instances of ``NXfit_parameter``).

field.name: function_type
field.doc:
Type of function used.
Examples include "Gaussian" and "Lorentzian". In case a complicated functions, the the functional form of the function should be given by the ``formula_description`` field . The user is also encouraged to use the ``description`` field for describing the fit function in a human-readable way.
Application definitions may limit the allowed fit functions by using an enumeration for the ``function_type`` field.

field.name: description
field.doc: Human-readable short description of this fit function. Software tools may use this field to write their local description of the fit function.

field.name: formula_description
field.doc: Description of the mathematical formula of the function, taking into account the instances of ``TERM`` in ``fit_parameters``.

field.name: PARAMETER
field.doc: A parameter for a fit function. This would typically be a variable that is optimized in a fit.

attribute.name: description
attribute.doc: A description of what this parameter represents.

attribute.name: initial
attribute.doc: The initial value of the parameter used in fitting.

attribute.name: vary
attribute.doc: True if the parameter was varied during fitting.

attribute.name: min
attribute.doc: The minimal value of the parameter, to be used as a constraint during fitting.

attribute.name: max
attribute.doc: The maximal value of the parameter, to be used as a constraint during fitting.
